thread.title: Top travel photos of the week
thread.title_full: Top travel photos of the week

title: Top travel photos of the week
text:
Top travel photos of the week Last updated 08:04, August 7 2015 KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters INTS KALNINS INTS KALNINS/Reuters Reuters PAVEL REBROV/Reuters MIGUEL VIDAL/Reuters MIGUEL VIDAL/Reuters MIGUEL VIDAL/Reuters EDUARDO MUNOZ/Reuters EDUARDO MUNOZ/Reuters EDUARDO MUNOZ/Reuters FABRIZIO BENSCH/Reuters SERGIO MORAES/Reuters DARREN WHITESIDE/Reuters DARREN WHITESIDE/Reuters DARREN WHITESIDE Mario Tama/Getty Images Matt Cardy/Getty Images Matt Cardy ALKIS KONSTANTINIDIS/Reuters ALEXANDRE MENEGHINI/Reuters CARLO ALLEGRI/Reuters STEPHANE MAHE/Reuters OMAR SANADIKI/Reuters STEPHANE MAHE/Reuters STEPHANE MAHE/Reuters JASON LEE/Reuters PAUL HACKETT/Reuters Ilia Yefimovich/Getty Images Ilia Yefimovich/Getty Images Matthew Stockman/Getty Images Matt Cardy/Getty Images Tabatha Fireman/Getty Images Tristan Fewings/Getty Images Matt Cardy/Getty Images Ulet Ifansasti/Getty Images Ulet Ifansasti Ulet Ifansasti/Getty Images Borja Sanchez Trillo/Getty Images Sascha Schuermann/Getty Images Carl Court/Getty Images Lintao Zhang/Getty Images Chris McGrath/Getty Images Clive Rose/Getty Images 
Revellers dance as they listen to the music in front of the main stage during the 21st Woodstock Festival in Kostrzyn-upon-Odra, Poland. 
Vocalist Frah of Shaka Ponk performs as he jumps to the crowd from the main stage during the 21st Woodstock Festival in Kostrzyn-upon-Odra, Poland. 
An estimated 200,000 people attended the ongoing festival, a brainchild of Polish journalist and social campaigner Jerzy Owsiak. 
Owsiak initiated the event to say thank you to those who donated money to his GOCC charity organisation that delivers medical care for children. 
Festival goers in front of the main stage during the 21st Woodstock Festival in Kostrzyn-upon-Odra, Poland. 
A woman reacts to the camera during the Holi festival, or the Festival of Colors, in Riga, Latvia. 
People wear protection masks as they attend the Holi festival, or the Festival of Colors, in Riga, Latvia. Primarily observed in India, the ancient Hindu religious festival has spread to other regions of the world. 
People participate in the opening parade of the festivities of El Divino Salvador del Mundo (The Divine Savior of The World), patron saint of the capital city of San Salvador, El Salvador . 
Visitors to the Befooz electronic music festival, which was banned by the Crimean prosecutor's office, relax at the sea during sunset in the village of Popovka, Crimea. 
People dressed as Vikings sail on a boat during the annual Viking festival of Catoira in north-western Spain. 
The festival re-enacts past Viking raids in the area and is celebrated annually on the first Sunday of August. 
A man dressed as a Viking drinks local red wine during the annual Viking festival of Catoira 
A dog passes by as people watch images being projected onto the Empire State Building, as part of an endangered species projection to raise awareness, in New York. 
An image of an animal is projected onto the Empire State Building. 
An image of the earth is projected onto the Empire State Building. 
The moon rises next to a cross atop of the Reichstag building in Berlin, German. 
People practice Acro-yoga near Arpoador beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Acro-yoga is a physical practice which combines yoga and acrobatics. 
A male orangutan rests on a dock while a tourist boat waits at Camp Leakey in Tanjung Puting National Park in Central Kalimantan province, Indonesia. 
The endangered orangutan is a solitary animal and it is rare to sight these great apes in groups, but this is Camp Leakey in the Tanjung Puting National Park in Indonesia and home to around 6000 rescued orangutans. 
The park in Borneo's central Kalimantan has been protecting great apes for 38 years but its success is now a problem as the reserve does not have sufficient space and resources to sustain any more apes. 
People gather in the water off Arpoador, outside Guanabara Bay, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. 
Holidaymakers enjoy the fine sunny weather at Porthmeor Beach in St Ives in Cornwall, England. 
Surfers walk out of the sea as the sun sets at Porthmeor Beach in St Ives in Cornwall, England. 
A tourist swims inside the Blue Cave of the island of Kastellorizo, Greece's easternmost island. 
A male Rottweiler named Luca walks at the main touristic road in downtown Havana. 
People tour the Luray Caverns in Luray, Virginia. The caverns, some as deep as 164 feet below the earth, featuring stalactites, stalagmites, are a top tourist attraction and see thousands of visitors each year. 
A tourist poses for a souvenir picture near the Pyramid of the Louvre Museum in Paris. 
Visitors pose for a picture as one of them holds the Syrian national flag inside the Crac des Chevaliers, a UNESCO World Heritage site, in the Homs countryside, Syria. Syria's tourism minister Bishr Yazigi has announced the re-opening of the Crac des Chevaliers for tourists and the start of the al-Wadi festival. 
A tourist poses for a photo souvenir in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, France. France has been the world's most visited country since the 1980's, welcoming 84 million tourists last year. 
Tourists relax on the grass of the Champ de Mars in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, France. 
Tourists are seen outside the Shenwumen Gate of the Forbidden City on a sunny day in central Beijing. 
Tourists take photographs in Trafalgar Square, London. London's Science Museum, and Natural History Museum are first and second most Googled Museums in the world according to London and Partners. The same research claims London is also the most Googled city in the world for art galleries, performing arts and innovative art and design. 
Israelis and tourists gather at the beach in Tel Aviv, Israel. 
People flock to Israel's beaches as the country sweltered in a heatwave. 
The sun rises over Guanabara Bay, site of sailing events for the Rio 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. 
Balloons take to the skies at to launch the Tribute Bristol International Balloon Fiesta in Bristol, England. The four day event event is now in its 37th year and is Europe's largest annual hot air balloon event in the city that is seen as many as the home of modern ballooning. 
A police officer advises festival goer of the new route that has been set for the parade during Brighton Pride 2015 in Brighton, England. 
Race goers in the Best Dressed competition on day four of the Qatar Goodwood Festival at Goodwood Racecourse in Chichester, England. 
The moon rises over people gathered on Glastonbury Tor in Somerset, England. 
A general view of the Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park, the location of the Tenggerese villages where the Tenggerese Hindu Yadnya Kasada Festival is held. 
Tenggerese worshippers are seen inside the Widodaren cave as they collect holy water during the Tenggerese Hindu Yadnya Kasada festival in Probolinggo, East Java, Indonesia. The festival is the main festival of the Tenggerese people and lasts about a month. On the fourteenth day, the Tenggerese make the journey to Mount Bromo to make offerings of rice, fruits, vegetables, flowers and livestock to the mountain gods by throwing them into the volcano's caldera. 
The origin of the festival lies in the 15th century when a princess named Roro Anteng started the principality of Tengger with her husband Joko Seger, and the childless couple asked the mountain Gods for help in bearing children. The legend says the Gods granted them 24 children but on the provision that the 25th must be tossed into the volcano in sacrifice. The 25th child, Kesuma, was finally sacrificed in this way after initial refusal, and the tradition of throwing sacrifices into the caldera to appease the mountain Gods continues today. 
Supporters of LGBT community ride bicycles during the fourth gay pride parade in Hanoi, Vietnam. 
People play video games at the Gamescom 2015 gaming trade fair in Cologne, Germany. Gamescom is the world's largest digital gaming trade fair. 
An employee poses next to part of an installation by artist Penny Woolcock entitled 'Utopia' at the Roundhouse theatre in London, England. Running from 4th to 23rd August, 'Utopia' is a city experienced through imagined environments with narrative soundscapes featuring stories that are pertinent to the parallel lives being lived in the world's biggest cities. 
A rainbow appears over the city onin Beijing, China. 
People carry lanterns past the Atomic Bomb Dome at the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park in Hiroshima, Japan. Japan is preparing to mark the 70th anniversary of the first atomic bomb that was dropped by the United States on Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. 
Orlando Duque of Colombia competes in 16th FINA World Championships at the Kanzanka River in Kazan, Russia. 1 of 48 
Here is our round up of the top travel photos from around the world. 
Do you have a favourite? Let us know in the comments.
